Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gadi b
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed there for 5 nights. The room was rather large and comfortable, the food was very good, and the location is excellent. I would like to point out that the staff is friendly and they allowed us both an eraly arrivel and a late check out. 2 flaws that i want to point out: 1. the bathroom door is made of glass, and not exactly soundproof ( if you know what i mean).... 2. One afternoon we returned to our room at 14:30 and the room still hasn't been made, we were told that the rooms are made between 9-15, but in my opinion 15:00 is a bit late...

Reviews.Title: “Very Average but ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ClairB77
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Lindner Hotel Am Ku-damm with 16 colleagues as we travelled to Berlin for a business trip. The hotel is certainly in an ideal location but I would say the standard of accomodation was a little average (I would class the hotel as 3 star based on its limited facilities). It you are travelling on the cheap and simply want a good central base this this hotel is adequate but is want a little more luxury then I would spend the extra money and stay elsewhere. Was very surprised this hotel did not have a bar or any facilitiy to get food or beverages on site apart from breakfast within the designated times. I asked for Double Rooms for single person use but was given a tiny room with a single bed and just one pillow. An average hotel for a frills stay but not really suited to couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: D G
Reviews.Content: I am in Berlin every month for my job and for me it is really the best deal for high quality of service. The rooms are big, clean and very comfortable. You can be easily upgraded into a Business suite for just 20 €. It worths the price. Location of the hotel is perfect. Their breakfast choice is amazing and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: Amina F
Reviews.Content: Accommodation v.good .all services good .but the breakfast was very expensive ,they also wanted to charge my grandchildren the same as an adult.there ages were7and5.The location was excellent,I will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Berlin”
Reviews.Author: streviews
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lindner Hotel Am Ku-damm for two nights on a stopover in Berlin, travelling alone. The hotel has a very nice exterior, and this overflowed to the interior which was very stylish, I liked the architecture and decor of the hotel. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful and the hotel entrance welcoming. Everything inside was very well appointed. My room was excellent and everything was clean and well-equipped. En-suite very good too, also had internet (can't remember if it was wireless or not) which was reliable. The hotel is in a very safe part of town in downtown Berlin, you can go out for walks at night without worrying about being approached by anyone etc. I would hate for the hotel to put its prices up, but I got a good promotional deal and was able to stay at a hotel I felt would usually have been out of my price range.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: RaymondOslo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, centrally located to Kurfurstendam. Great access to the Airport bus to Tegel. No free WIFI, but free internet if you plug to computer. Also be aware, the bathroom is a part of the bedroom, open space! So if you travel with friend or colleague, do not choose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A truely excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: FazerWiz
Reviews.Content: I should stary by saying that I don't think we had a standard room here. I booked through the Agoda website for B & B and the room was discribed as a "First Class" room although I only paid £85 per night B&B. Our room (238) was a real surprise, we had a huge 7 foot wide bed, the bathroom was as big as the bedroom with a huge shower, full sized bath, separate toilet and twin basens. We had our own Internet terminal as well as a large desk and chair.On a two week tour of Europe, this was both the cheapist and best city hotel we stayed in. The location is perffect, secure underground parking is only 3 euros a night, It's right in amongst the action in a nice part of the city with shops open until 10 pm and lots of places to eat nearby, free internet is available, in the room by cable only, but if you have a laptop it's easy to set that up as your own personal wifi station :) Breakfast is a big as you want with a buffet offering hot eggs (which a chef will cook to order), bacon, sausages, cerials, jucies, smoked salmon, even Latte coffee from the bar - in fact anything you could want., The hotel also has a small outside weingarten which yoiu can use for breakfast if the weather is kind to you. We did the Secret Belin walking tour which starts just 5 mins from this hotel and is a must if you're want to get a sense of this amazing city and all it has to offer. I'd recommend doing it on your first day then you can really get a feel of where else you'd like to visit. This hotel was a perfect choice for us, we'd definately book again if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndyPK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a recent trip to Berlin and found it to be a fantastic place to stay. The hotel was a fantastic base from which to explore Berlin. Kurfurstendamm U-Bahn station is a 1 minute walk from the hotel. The Zoolischer Garten U-Bahn and Bus station is around 5 minutes walk around the back of the Hotel - as is Berlin Zoo. At Zoolischer Garten station you can catch the 100 bus for a couple of Euro's which will get you to the Reichstag/Brandenburg Gate and other places of interest within 10-15 minutes. The hotel is also just a short walk away from Kaiser-Wilhelm Gedachtniskirche. There are a host of shops - ranging from small tourist type shops to the Tommy Hilfiger store on the Ku'Damm. Also, a mixture of small and large eateries and places to get a drink. The Ku'Damm is obviously very noisy until late at night and our hotel room looked out to the front of the hotel but the room was very quiet with the balcony door closed and the room offered excellent air con too! The breakfast is excellent and offers a wide selection of choices - fruits, yoghurts, croissants, cereals, sausage, eggs, bacon, pastries - you name it! Staff were friendly and helpful always. My only (very) small gripe was that our room was a little small - but as we were using it purely as a base to explore the city, this really wasn't much of an issue. If you have children with you - beware the rather explicit adult channels on the TV - there appears to be no parental lock on this! All in, this is a fantastic hotel, great links for eating drinking and transport, friendly, knowledgable staff and a welcoming atmosphere. Thank you Lindner, Ku'Damm - we would without doubt stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely...a really convenient location and great spot!”
Reviews.Author: Anahita06
Reviews.Content: Such a lovely hotel. Located just next to the Zoo Station and the Ku'damm stop just outside the door. It's really easy to get around from there. It was a beautiful sunny long weekend and the hotel was the best setting for our romantic weekend away. Really enjoyed the large bed with all rooms facing the lovely tree lined street outside. Great bathroom...brilliant power shower and great bath! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Linder Hotel Am Ku'damm, don't forget to visit Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: LuisOlachea
Reviews.Content: AMAZING service, well located, confortable, clean, the perfect way to visit Berlin. At the Front Desk, Jacqueline is very attentive, and Nicole is out of this world, they should place her smile in every train station and airport to make you feel welcome to Berlin! She's so natural and authentic at her position that you'd wish to have her as your guide through all over Berlin! I work as HR Director on a high end UltraLuxury Resort in México , and I can tell you that their whole staff is wonderfull!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, well placed, style, top breakfast”
Reviews.Author: duonier
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days with 2 teenagers (2 rooms). Next to public transport, restaurants shops, etc... The breakfast was excellent. Good yoghurt (not the chemical stuff), real juces, full english 'zutaten'. Friendly personnel, really an above average experience. Rooms and corridors well decorated, bathroom and toilet modern and clean. The connection to the airport is straightforward (5 to 10 mins wallk to tiergarten station, with direct link to schoenberg airport_. Both rooms were fine incl flat screen tv, and internet (via cable, but cable provided). Only observation; toilet has opaque glass door without 'lock', so people that need a lot of privacy in the toilet have to be 'creative'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cityfan097
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to public transport and, very usefully, opposite a tourist info centre (were we experienced top service). Hotel is very modern, well thought out design and trendy decor. There is an inner courtyard garden where you can eat and drink and escape the bustle of the city. The bathroom area is actually situated in the room, the shower door is clear glass thus maybe not appealing to all who share a room! The WC has an opaque glass door. Toiletries etc.consisted of one small body lotion and shampoo. Not much for a 4* hotel. Soap is provided in dispensers. Beds were ok but pillows were awful - disintegrated foam. Staff were fine. Breakfast costs e18 per person so if all you want is a slice of toast and coffee you'd be better off looking at local coffee shops where a coissant/coffee costs e5. Parents be warned - browsing with the TV controller gives explicit access to adult viewing channels! Having said all this I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location- great way to end our trip”
Reviews.Author: HomeInTexas
Reviews.Content: This was the sixth and final hotel in our two-week trip through Europe and a very close second favorite (Ameron Flora in Lucerne had free breakfast, so it gets the win!). We really lucked out with this hotel as we booked it online the day we got to Berlin. We had reservations at a beautiful pension which was promised to us over the phone to be wheelchair accessible, but quickly discovered after showing up to check in that it was not. This hotel was very accessible, and probably ended up being a better place to stay for only 15 euros more a night. The staff was helpful, there was a computer with internet access to use in the lobby, and the location was fantastic- both the Zoologischer Garten station and the Ku'damm stations were very close by. There is all sorts of shopping on Ku'damm, and the sightseeing bus stops right outside the hotel. The room was quite nice with comfy beds, lots of pillows, and a nice separate seating/work area, although having a curtain instead of a bathroom door was a bit odd. There was a separate door to the toilet area which provides some privacy though. Breakfast was delicious, but not worth the 18 euro each. We splurged on it since this was the last stop on our trip, but really should have gone to the bakery across the way or the many other bakeries near the Zoo station to eat for a fraction of the cost. Also, the phone charges were really high- we had to call a toll number to speak with the airlines for the trip home (the website for each airline said 15 cents a minute) but with the hotel charges, one call came out as 15 euro and the other as 8, even though we were only on the phone for 15 minutes total between the two calls. Be forewarned- use a pay phone for any toll calls! All in all it was a fantastic hotel, expensive breakfast and phone calls aside, and even if we had known that going in, we would still have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Katrin4
Reviews.Content: Lindner is a very nice hotel, situated directly on Ku'Dam. The rooms are good sized, but the "open" bathroom situastion can be a bit too much. There is no chance for privacy the way these rooms are designed. For example, when you lie in bed you can actually look directly into the shower. Its only glass closing the shower with no kind of shadow so nothing is left to the imagination. Its all nice to look at and very new and fancy, but maybe not the best room to share with anyone but your girlfriend/boyfriend...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but ensure you get the right price & skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: robert092
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern hotel - very well located. An excellent 4 star - we found prices of 70 euro in Expedia Also skip the breakfast if you want to save money - many bakeries nearby

Reviews.Title: “good base in central Berlin (west)”
Reviews.Author: anemonefish
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in this Lindner hotel and were quite satisfied with our stay. The location is near public transport and surrounded by shopping and restaurants, as well as tourist facilities. The business-class room (i.e., bathroom with shower and tub as a separate room behind the sleeping space) faced the main street. Large windows blocked noise reasonably well, though on the 5th floor we still heard some celebrating below. There was some control of A/C and the windows opened slightly at the top. Scant storage space. Minibar. The amenities were adequate in all respects. Free Ethernet on a work table with plenty of plugs plus WiFi if needed at a fee. Typically sterile Euro-modern styling that's functional but without much character or charm. The lobby is small and suitable for arrivals and check-outs only. Conference space on 1st floor. The restaurant was OK, but limited. Room service offered a few items and was a little inconsistent, though food quality was always good. Their "giant" hamburger is huge, and very much to American taste. Breakfast (included in our package) offered a nice variety, though the space is unpleasantly cramped when the hotel is full. They need an egg timer, and sometimes produced soft boiled eggs that were rocks in the center and runny outside (microwave?). Staff was consistently pleasant and helpful. Arrangement with fitness center in a nearby building. Perhaps not the best place for a luxurious or romantic vacation, but very suitable for a business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Most Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Alones
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 days stay at the Lindner Hotel AM KU'DAMM in Berlin . Excellent Hotel with perfect location . very near to the U and S stations . The Room was very comfortable and modern and most important ........ With Air condition . We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel ( 18 Euro ) , There is a very nice coffee and bakery right in front of the hotel . The hotel is very clean and the front desk reception is very helpful , Great service !!! Very Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, good value.”
Reviews.Author: SaleM33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in July at a very good price. I had a single room which was ,perhaps, small but was perfectly acceptable. The bed was comfortable and the room (6th floor over looking interior courtyard) was very quiet. The bathroom was clean and had a very good shower. I didn't eat any meals there. For breakfast, if you only want a croissant/coffee, there is a bakery directly opposite the hotel entrance. For other meals, try Reinhardts (on Ku'damm) or the Bier Saal on corner on Ku'damm opposite hotel. Most of the sights are in former East Berlin but travel on the S or U Bahn is eay and very cheap. Potsdam, outside, Berlin, is also easily accessible and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, especially if you get it on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: concentriq
Reviews.Content: In summary: Great clean/modern hotel, in great location (if the very heart of West Berlin is your thing), great service, definitely recommend. I am not going to describe the surrounding area in too much detail: chances are if you are looking at this hotel, you know what youare in for, but its right next to shopping, eating, 2 blocks from the station, 1 block from u-bahn. the shopping on KU' damm going west was a bit too posh, and a bit too many italian places for german city. I think this hotel usually goes for a lot more than what we paid for it, but we lucked out paying $100 a night staying on top floor in the corner room.. overlooking the entire square. My girlfriend and I didnt mind, but it could be a warning for some: either stay there by yourself or if you are comfortable with your partner: 1. The bathroom (the shower/sink part) has no door, but is sort of hidden from the rest of the room 2. Toilet is in a separate room away from the bathroom. And also, our room, which was a corner room, had 2 of its 4 walls as windows.. including the bathroom. there were heavy drapes so, the choice to let your inner-exhibitionist out was entirely yours ;-). I dont believe that most of the rooms in the hotel have the same "feature".

Reviews.Title: “Business plus”
Reviews.Author: Genussmensch
Reviews.Content: Lindner's at Kurfuerstendamm looks like a chain hotel but acts differently. Already from the second visit they know your whims and act accordingly. You find two pillows instead of one. They know that you want a non-smoking room and the shower to be on level with the bathroom floor. The furnishings are simple to cool but in your room you find everything you need. For a modern building, the rooms show a great variety of sizes and layouts. For its location in the metropolis and its class, the prices are moderate. Cable LAN is available in every room free of charge. The restaurant is acceptable, breakfast costing extra, is a meal in itself.

Reviews.Title: “average but noise/light problem”
Reviews.Author: cocos_knight
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average, nothing special, nothing to remember, nothing to look forward to. * Rooms are small but well maintained. Didn't like that the toilet had a glass door facing the bed. Did miss some basic amenities such as a shoe horn ... * Corridors reminded me of some 1960s administrative building. * Breakfast was disappointing - there was some selection but nothing that really appealed to me. * Hotel is well connected with a metro and bus stop just round the corner. So far everything just average. However there were two problems which were really disturbing: - One side of the hotel faces a huge office building that is lit up brightly all night through and there's no way to completely shade the windows of the room. - On the same side of the hotel the corridor between the hotel and this office building will reflect and amplify the noise from the frequently passing trains. Even though the windows are otherwise soundproof the train noise gets through and is disturbuing.

Reviews.Title: “Linder Hotel, Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Denosaur
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed for three nights due to her running the Berlin Marathon Sept 2007 Excellent, clean, quiet, comfortable, friendly, Hotel. Breakfast was more than adequate with plenty tasty fare. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best Deal For The $”
Reviews.Author: smoofy
Reviews.Content: I booked the Lindner for a 4 day stay with my boyfriend because the hotel's website made the rooms look very large and well-decorated. Not only that but the other Trip Advisor reviews seemed to confirm all this. I'm not sure why everyone liked this hotel so much. For $160 a night, I don't think it's a very great deal. The Mercure hotel at Berlin airport was even nicer and larger and included a bathtub for only $60 a night. It's also a 3 star hotel, which I believe would be a more appropriate rating for the Lindner for several reasons. The rooms are small, there is no bath tub (only a shower with a clear glass door), privacy (as others have mentioned) is an issue because there is no door seperating the bathroom from the main room (they are in the same room) and you can hear everything that goes on in there. The doors to the shower and toilet are made of a frosted glass which you can see through. There are no handles, but holes cut in the glass to act as handles and so this also impeeds your privacy and in the case of the shower allows water to get through. This does not make for a very romantic setting, needless to say. On top of that, my resevation was not ready on time. I arrived at the airport a bit ahead of schedule and visited the Lindner to see if there was anyway I could get a room earlier as I was exhausted from the flight. They explained that I would have to come back at 3. So in a complete daze with no where to rest I wandered the streets of Berlin for 4 hours. I returned to the Lindner a couple minutes before 3 and was informed there was no room for me. I watched as several couples (German-speaking I should note) were lead up to their rooms without hesitation. Finally, at 4:30 I was informed that a room was available. Later a bowl of fruit and some mineral water was sent up to help smooth over my discomfort with the situation. I should note that once the fruit was finished the maids did not remove the remains (banana peels, pits, etc.) which were left to rot in the room during our entire stay. I'd like to say that at least they tried, but I don't think the Lindner tries very hard to accomodate its guests very well. I think they just want your money and that it could be better spent elsewhere (a 3 star hotel for example would be just as nice). We also had numerous problems with our key cards not working and had to exchange them at the front desk several times. I would advise people who are looking for a nice fun place to stay in Berlin to stay elsewhere- possibly pay more for a really nice place like the Swissotel or if you're a young couple stay someplace outside the shopping district of Ku Damm. I would recommend staying near Potsdammer Platz, Alexander Platz, or elsewhere in Mitte because that is where all the historic sights and clubs are. The Kudamm is really just one big tourist mall that is several stops away on the U-Ban from anything intereting. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: OCinHK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in June. It was great! Room was clean and modern at an excellent location. The room was also very quiet. It was great value for money. The refreshing ice water with fruit in the lobby is a nice touch. Although there was only 1 internet station at the hotel, it was always available. i wonder why nobody uses it. One down side is that there's no shampoo or conditioner in the toiletry. They provided sample shampoo product for men.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: JayeffSydney
Reviews.Content: My second stay in Berlin was at the Lindner on Ku'damm, a much better location than October 2006 when I was in the depths of Mitte. The Lindner was very comfortable, the room had a good bed, good bathroom, and along with very helpful staff, a great location, and great shops etc nearby I have no negative comments. Transport is easy with U Bahn and S Bahn very close by. The hotel is also great value for money. In particular, I liked the free internet in the lobby, free Herald Tribunes every day - and free apples! But not all Lindner hotels are as generous, as I found in Koln.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: lepstein
Reviews.Content: Sparkling clean and new, this hotel is in a great location close to Zoo rail station, the S-Bahn, and U-Bahn (presuming that this is the part of Berlin in which you want to be, as there are many other great areas of the city, too). Quiet and ultra-modern, this hotel seems to attract mainly business folk but should suit anyone who can handle this price-point. The breakfast, while not cheap, was extremely good and bountiful, although the room was a bit crowded during "rush hour".

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Lindner”
Reviews.Author: catmint
Reviews.Content: We visited the Lindner for 3 nights and had a wondeful stay. Although we had the smallest room type, it was spotlessly clean and very comfortable, and we had a nice view of the Ku' Damm too. Reception staff were friendly and efficient. As others have mentioned, privacy may be an issue at the Lindner, with the stylish glass and full length mirrors leaving nowhere to hide when taking a shower (although presumably only children will be tempted to peek through the hole in the frosted toilet door!). For this reason, I'd recommend sharing a room only with someone you already know very well. The only other niggle was that we had to struggle a bit to get the room-width windows covered by the black-out curtain - but it is possible. We weren't disturbed by any noise. However, the quirky layout aside, the rooms are very nice and the beds large and comfy. There is a safe and minibar, and a wardrobe with hangers and an umbrella which we were very glad to borrow, and a suitcase stand - in fact everything that is needed is there. I think it lives up well to its 4 stars. Public areas are pleasant and the modern art is a nice touch. There is a slick, business-like feel to the hotel, and in fact there were quite a few business people staying there, but tourists were made to feel welcome too. There's a free internet connection just off the lobby if you need to look anything up, which is useful. We didn't eat there, so can't comment on the food. There are many choices for food nearby. The location is easy to reach by public transport. We look forward to returning to the Lindner next time we visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, location ok”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, the reception staff not always very friendly, but ok. Location, close to U-bahn and Zoo Bahnhof is great. Restaurant was very quit in the evening, but the food was good. For Berlin it was an okay hotel to stay, not to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All Round - Loved It”
Reviews.Author: SCookie
Reviews.Content: Six of us (2 couples with 2 and 3 year old girls) have just got back, wow. This hotel is in a great location, especially for shopping. The tour bus (that we took and got us to all of the locations that you might want to see) starts from opposite, so great starting point for sightseeing too. The room was spacious, although not what I would really call a “junior suite” as they refer to it. No separate sitting area, but huge bathroom with bath and shower, and plenty of hanging space. Hey you've got Berlin outside your door, so why would you want to sit in the room anyway. Beds were on the firm side, but were lovely and comfortable, and although we had all of the neon and beautiful Christmas lights right outside the window, the black out curtains did exactly what they should. Breakfast has a great choice and was one of the best I have had for a while. Hot choices included bacon, eggs (boiled, scrambled or fried/omelette on request), sausages and the ‘best’ sausage patties. Then there are yoghurts, fruit, pastries, cereals, various breads, jams, preserves, cheeses, smoked salmon, meats (including delicious cold roast beef, not usual for me for breakfast, but why not, when in Berlin/Rome). If you cannot find a selection for yourself here for a hearty breakfast, then you must have very fussy tastes. The staff were friendly and welcoming and looked after us very well. Always a smile and a hello as we left and returned and when we asked for iron and dental kits at nearly midnight just after we checked in, they arrived within minutes. Hotel Lintner is very modern, first class, and was also great value for the deal we had. We used German Transfer to get to and from the airport. They were there waiting for us on arrival and picked us up from the hotel for our return at the exact time they said they would. Very efficient, great value at 31 euros each way, and much less expensive than a lot of other companies that quoted for the same trip. In fact nearly half the price of another that I almost booked. The driver on the way back played traditional Christmas music (not Slade/Wham etc.) and even gave our 3 year old daughter and her friend a chocolate bar when we got to the airport, which was a lovely touch. Berlin is amazing and we will definitely be going back soon, great in everyway, especially the people who were extremely friendly and welcoming. If you are considering going then do it, and I would recommend this hotel, we will likely stay here again. Only one negative, we tried to eat at the sports bar opposite the hotel, and we were more or less ignored 3 or 4 times, and when we did get a table, we eventually went and helped ourselves to the menus, and were then ignored again for 25 minutes, at which point we left, and had a wonderful great value Italian just of Ku'damm at Ristorante Avanti, Rankestr. 2. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Woodster8
Reviews.Content: Think we stayed in same suite as Jade girl on a special deal free upgrade with 30% off food and mini bar. Hotel is modern and our room was excellent, spacious and very modern. The bathroom had a bath for a hippo, as well as a shower cubical for the morning wake me u. As some of the previous reveiws have said all the doors are frosted glass but as long as your not too self concious nothing to worry about. Blackout curtains shut out the christmas lights with no problem. Overall the 3 days we stayed at the Ku 'dam were fab, staff very freindly and a good feed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lindner Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadegirl
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend break at this hotel. My boyfriend took me as a surpise to see the Christmas markets and I have to say it was brilliant. The hotel is located right on the main shopping street (think Oxford Street only not as croweded and CLEAN!) and there are plenty of shops to keep you entertained. We ate in the Hotel one night and the menu was limited but very nice. The breakfast is unbelievable, so much choice. We started with a fry up, then had the cheeses, hams, then the croissants, it's a wonder we could get up from the table. I cant say what the standard rooms were like as we stayed in a suite on the 3rd floor, which was amazing. It had a front room area separated from the bedroom with a long cabinet with the flat screen tv inside which you could spin around depending where you wanted to watch it. The bathroom was massive, with lovely green glass doors, separate toilet area. It even had an office area with desk/laptop. The staff are all really friendly and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Kippie13
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Lindner. The location, at the Kurfurstendamm, is excellent. The hotel's public areas and rooms are well appointed and modern and trendy. But.... this seems to be typically one of those hotels that forget what a hotel is for: a good night's sleep in a comfortable room. That is exactly what this hotel doesn't offer..... We made a reservation for a two bed non smoking de luxe room. Upon arrival we were told that it would either have to be a smoking room or a one - not very big - bed room. No upgrade or other alternative were offered. As we arrived late, we did not have the energy to go out again and look for another hotel, so we took the one bed room. The room itself was rather small for a de luxe room, but I guess that is the case in almost every big city. The real problems with the room were that 1) it was located opposite a very brightly lit building and the black out curtains were too short to darken the room, 2) the toilet comes out immediately on the room, opposite the bed and it has a glass door (everything going on in there clearly visible and audible for the other person in the room), 3) the bathroom also comes out immediately on the room opposite the bed and has no door at all (everything going on there clearly visible from the whole room also). Because of the peculiar lay-out of the room, it is impossible to have any privacy at all in the bathroom or the toilet. Friends of us were staying in the same hotel and their room had the same lay-out , so it was not just a bad-luck-room that we had. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, as there are many hotels in Berlin who, at the same rate or less, offer better comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Why not?”
Reviews.Author: ab69
Reviews.Content: Why not Lindner Hotel? Maybe just because there is a great choice of good hotels in Berlin. I think that this hotel is first of all in a perfect location, in the opposite corner of Swissotel, and it is modern with a good design, it is very clean, the staff is friendly...... So there are some very good hotels in Berlin, I have been to Ku'damm 101 (not so close to the center) and to Swissotel (more expensive), but in Lindner you can find a fare of less then EUR 100,00 that is simply incredible for an hotel of this kind! And you can also ask for a free pass for the wellness center in the last floor of the building that is in front of the hotel: you can have a sauna, a steam bath or use the exercise rooms with a wonderful panorama of Berlin from the 15th floor's glazed walls. Finally, the only bad thing is that you must be very carefully with the glazed door of the wc (it hits a metal block-system) and with the glazed door of the shower (it is easy to find a lake outside).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: MichelleMar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 4 nights in Mid March and had an excellent experience. Bus 109 from the airport drops you off in front. The Metro and Bus lines were very well connected with the rest of the city (esp. buses 100 and 200 - which were like taking a city tour!). The staff and the hotel itself was wonderful. I couldn't have asked for more! Definitely would repeat and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMikeDurham
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay in this hotel. We travelled with two other couples to this hotel and I'm pleased to say that it met all of our expectations. The hotel is in a good location with the underground station (Kurfurstendamn) and train station (Zoologisher Garten) on the door step. All the sights of Berlin were easy to get to using the underground which cost just over 5 Euro each for an all day pass. The hotel and rooms are very clean with large shower and there are glass doors on all w.c.'s so privacy can be maintained. Breakfast was good with hot and cold selections available and all staff when needed were all too happy to help. The hotel is also really close to some great shops and a number of good restaurants if you want to stay local after a day visiting the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Really gone downhill......”
Reviews.Author: pixie4963
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel last year and had a pretty ok experience and would have recommended it no probs. This year it seems a v different place. No smiles from the check in desk on arrival and the room although "funky" in design didn't have a kettle or a trouser press. Breakfast was not a good experience with almost all the tables taken up by laptop/mobile phone users having loud business meetings and we had to squeeze on the end of a table to eat our food! For a bit more cash go to the Radission SAS in the historic centre and be treated like a valued guest!!

Reviews.Title: “Very very pleased with the Lindnerhotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mania71
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a mini trip to Berlin and though we have booked our 4 night stay at the Concorde, due to a problem with our booking there, we had to stay somewhere elsa for the first night. Anyway we wnet directly to this hotel and they had available rooms so they checked us in immediately with no problem at a first class double room. The room aws spotless, on the fourth floor, with a huge wall-to-wall window, the double room was really two singles pushed together and the bathroom was huge, behind the bedroom wall, so even if there are no doors separating it you can't be seen from the bed. It had seperate enclosed toilet, bathtub and two sinks separated by the huge glass shower! There were lots of toiletries in the bathroom, coffemaker, umbrella and of course two bathrobes and slippers. The only con was the room decoration which was spartan and that wou couldn't take a shower or using the bathroom without waking up the other. Now the breakfast, it was great with very delicious food,but not perfect, i would appreciate more variety at the egg-cooking (only scrambled or hard boiled) and some more pastries, but generally it was good and the breakfast room spotless! And ofcourse the location is perfect, right in the middle of the Kudamm with everything around! I have taken a lot of pictures and i'll try to post them later. I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin for the first time, but for the next time i'll choose a hotel at the East to be closer to the sights!

HotelInfo.Name: Lindner Hotel Am Ku'damm
HotelInfo.Address: Kurfurstendamm 24, 10719 Berlin, Germany
